content.text: Complete the tally and frequency columns in the table
Find the range
Find the median
Olga counts the number of letters in each of the last 50 words in the book she is reading
She has only counted the letters in 43 words so far
Her results for these 43 words are shown in the table below
The last seven words in the book that Olga needs to add to the table are
and they all lived happily ever after
Complete the key
Complete the pictogram
Write down the mode
Work out how many more students choose detective books than music books
Work out the fraction of students who did **not** choose romance books
Billie asks 60 students in his school what their favourite type of book is
He has started to draw a pictogram to show his results
Key: □□ represents .........books.
The science fiction row in the pictogram is complete
Mr Marr asks his mathematics class to complete a statistics project about books
the number twenty seven million, three hundred and sixty thousand and forty five in figures,
the six factors of 20,
a fraction that is equivalent to \(\frac{7}{9}\),
a prime number between 30 and 40
Write down
For each statement, insert one pair of brackets to make it correct
Work out how much he spends on music
Work out how much more he spends on clothes than books
Victor spends \(40\%\) of his \$600
He spends the money in the ratio clothes : books : music = 10 : 2 : 3
Walter invests his \$600 for 3 years at a rate of \(4.5\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the interest Walter receives at the end of the 3 years
Xavier goes on holiday to Europe and changes his \$600 into euros (€)
He spends €325 whilst he is on holiday
When he gets home he changes the euros he has left back into dollars
The exchange rate is \$1 = €0.864
Work out how many dollars he has left after his holiday
Give your answer correct to the nearest cent
Three boys each have \$600
Write down the mathematical name for the quadrilateral \(PQRS\)
Write down the co-ordinates of \(S\)
Measure the obtuse angle \(PSR\)
Measure the length of the line \(PQ\)
Work out the perimeter of the quadrilateral \(PQRS\)
triangle \(\mathbf{A}\) onto triangle \(\mathbf{B}\),
triangle \(\mathbf{A}\) onto triangle \(\mathbf{C}\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps
On the grid, draw the image of triangle \(\mathbf{D}\) after a translation by the vector \(\left(- \frac{1}{2}\right)\)
The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(PQRS\) which is made from four congruent triangles \(\mathbf{A}\) , \(\mathbf{B}\) , \(\mathbf{C}\) and \(\mathbf{D}\)
Complete the scatter diagram
The first eight points have been plotted for you
One person completes more levels per hour than any of the others
On the scatter diagram, put a ring around the point for this person
What type of correlation does this scatter diagram show?
On the scatter diagram, draw a line of best fit
Another person, Monika, completed 19 levels but forgot to record the time spent playing
Use your line of best fit to estimate the number of hours that Monika spent playing
Lucy asked 12 people how many hours they each spent playing a computer game and the number of levels they each completed in one month
The results are shown in the table
The price of a ticket is \$13.50
Georgiana's ticket price is reduced by one-third because she is a student
Work out how much she pays for her ticket
Write 13 45 using the 12-hour clock
Work out how long the first train should take to travel from Redtown to Southford
Give your answer in hours and minutes
The first train arrives at Southford 46 minutes late
By how many minutes has Georgiana missed her second train?
Georgiana travels on two trains
The first train goes from Redtown to Southford
The second train goes from Southford to Teignley
She has written down some information about the times of her trains
While Georgiana waits for the next train, she buys a cup of hot chocolate
Work out which cup of hot chocolate is the best value
Show all your working
The next train from Southford to Teignley is at 18 12
The journey is \(76\mathrm{km}\) and the train travels at an average speed of \(48\mathrm{km / h}\)
Work out the time that the train arrives in Teignley
Georgiana is travelling by train from Redtown to Teignley
Work out the actual distance, in metres, between Annika's house and Bernhard's house
Measure the bearing of Bernhard's house from Annika's house
Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the perpendicular bisector of \(AB\)
Show all your construction arcs
Cordelia's house is
• the same distance from Annika's house and Bernhard's house
and
• due south of Annika's house
Mark on the map the position of Cordelia's house
Label this point \(C\)
Dougie's house is
• on a bearing of \(320^{\circ}\) from Bernhard's house
and
• \(1650\mathrm{m}\) from Annika's house
Mark on the map the two possible positions of Dougie's house
Label each of these points \(D\)
The scale drawing shows the positions of Annika's house, \(A\), and Bernhard's house, \(B\), on a map. The scale is 1 centimetre represents 300 metres
Explain what is happening when the two lines intersect on the travel graph
Work out Rob's speed in km/h
William leaves home at 07 25
He walks to school at a constant speed of \(6\mathrm{km / h.}\)
On the grid, draw William's journey
At what time is the distance between Rob and William greatest?
Complete this list of names in the order they arrive at school
First
Second
Three children from the same family travel from their home to the same school
Caroline cycles to school
Rob runs to school
William walks to school
The travel graph shows the journeys to school for Caroline and Rob
Rob leaves home before Caroline
the straight line \(AC,\)
the straight line \(AB.\)

Give a geometrical reason why angle \(ABC = 90^\circ\)
Use trigonometry to calculate angle \(BAC\)
Show that \(BC = 48 \text{cm}\)
Work out the area of triangle \(ABC\)
Work out the total shaded area
\(AB = 20 \text{cm}\) and \(AC = 52 \text{cm}\)
A, \(B\) and \(C\) are points on the circumference of a circle, centre \(O\)
Write down the gradient of the line \(y = -4x + 7\)
Write down the equation of a line parallel to \(y = 2x + 3\)
Write down the co-ordinates of the point where the graph of \(y = 6x - 5\) crosses the \(y\)-axis
The point \((k, 7)\) lies on the line \(y = 4x - 3\)
Find the value of \(k\)
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} - x - 5\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - x - 5\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\)
Write down the co-ordinates of the lowest point on the graph
(a) On the grid, draw the line of symmetry of the graph
